definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website

sentences.english: A polling station is where I vote and is listed on my Elector Information Card.
sentences.chinese: 投票站是我前往投票的地方，在選民登記列明地點。

sentences.english: He says there are no fictitious polling stations or pre-marked ballots.
sentences.chinese: 他說，沒有假投票站或做好記號的選票。

sentences.english: Haitians go to the polls on Sunday in a presidential election run-off.
sentences.chinese: 海地人週日將前往投票站，爲第二輪總統選舉投票。

sentences.english: Polling places in Seattle will ndot be open.
sentences.chinese: 在西雅圖的投票站將不會開放。

sentences.english: Only candidates may enter the dedicated polling stations situated in maximum security prisons.
sentences.chinese: 只有候選人可進入設於高度設防監獄的專用投票站。

sentences.english: The total of 5294 polling registered voters.
sentences.chinese: 這些投票站共有5294位登記選民。

sentences.english: Voting ballots are unsigned and marked by the voters in private booths.
sentences.chinese: 選票不記名，由選民在隔離的投票站填寫。

sentences.english: Salvadoreans head to the polls Sunday to elect a new president.
sentences.chinese: 星期天，薩爾瓦多人紛紛前往投票站選舉新的主席。

sentences.english: In Magwe Division, only polling stations in urban areas can be visited.
sentences.chinese: 在馬圭省，在城市唯一可以參觀一處投票站。
